bullets.text: House passes funding to end record shutdown; stocks rallied; October jobs and inflation reports may be lost.
SNAP benefits face disruption from shutdown-fueled funding halt, risking food security and economic drag for low-income households.
Boston Fed’s Collins favors holding rates; sees high bar for further cuts, signaling cautious policy amid uncertain data.
Supreme Court will hear Trump bid to fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook, testing central bank independence.
AI-driven demand lifts Cisco and AMD, beating estimates and raising guidance, reinforcing AI capex as key earnings driver.
Dow tops 48,000 as value stocks rally, broadening market leadership beyond mega-cap tech.
Global greenhouse gas emissions set to hit a record in 2025, complicating net-zero timelines and policy credibility.
U.K. greenlights a small modular reactor in Wales, advancing nuclear as baseload for decarbonization plans.
Investment in data centers now exceeds oil exploration, driving surging power demand and political backlash over electricity prices.
Anthropic unveils $50 billion U.S. AI infrastructure plan, starting with data centers in Texas and New York.
Waymo launches freeway robotaxi rides in San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Phoenix, marking a commercialization milestone for autonomous vehicles.
GLP-1 drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy reduce cardiovascular risk and are linked to sharply lower cancer mortality in studies.
Researchers report a material surpassing diamond’s hardness, with potential in cutting tools, wear-resistant coatings, and electronics.
Astronomers find three Earth-sized planets orbiting a binary star, broadening potential habitats in multi-star systems.
